isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - REMOVE - CAB AIR SUSPENSION system for 5000i SERIES After FEBRUARY 2001

svcproc.title: CAB AIR SUSPENSION system for 5000 i SERIES After FEBRUARY 2001

warning.para: For safety purposes cab air suspension must be supplied from a pressure protected air supply.

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 122 for Items in parentheses.

The cab air suspension system for the 5000 i Series after February 2001 contains two air springs (bags) (Item 1), two shock absorbers (Item 2), and is controlled by the height control valve (Item 3). The air suspension assembly (Figure 122) needs no lubrication and very little maintenance.

The following components - air lines (to air spring) (Item 4), elbow fittings (Item 6), tee fitting (Item 7), air springs (bags) (Item 1), height control valve (Item 3), shock absorbers (Item 2) and lateral control arm (Item 24) - should be checked at the time the vehicle is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve (Item 3), air springs (bags) (Item 1) and shock absorbers (Item 2) are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Height Control Valve

note.para: If there is an attempt to disassemble or adjust fittings on the height control valve (Item 3, Figure 122) , it will void the warranty. Contact the air suspension manufacturer for assistance.

step1.para: Drain air from air system.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from air system, be sure to set parking brake and/or block vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 121 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Press and hold release button against fitting body and pull air line (supply) (Item 1) from "SUPPLY" port of height control valve (Item 3).
Loosen compression nut (Item 4) of push to connect tee fitting (Item 12) in "SUSP" port of height control valve (Item 3) and pull air line (to air spring) (Item 2) from push to connect tee fitting.

Loosen other compression nut (Item 4) of push to connect tee fitting (Item 12) in "SUSP" port of height control valve (Item 3) and pull air line (to air spring) (Item 2) from push to connect tee fitting.

Remove height control valve linkage (Item 5) from threaded ball pivot (Item 25, Figure 122) by unlatching linkage clip and carefully pry the height control valve linkage socket from threaded ball pivot on height control valve lever (Item 6).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 122 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove two hex head bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 8 and 9) and remove height control valve (Item 3) from suspension crossmember bracket (Item 30).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Air Suspension Shock Absorber
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 122 for Items in parentheses.

note.para: Shock Absorber mounting bolts (Item 10 and 12) are reversed so that they are installed from the front instead of from the rear of the air suspension system on vehicles built after February 2001.

step1.para: Remove hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 10 and 11) at the left cab mount plate (Item 22) at the top of shock absorber (Item 2).
Remove hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 12 and 11) at the mounting bracket of suspension crossmember bracket (Item 30) at the bottom of shock absorber (Item 2).
Remove shock absorber (Item 2) from between left cab mount plate (Item 22) and suspension crossmember bracket (Item 30).
Remove hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 10 and 11) at the right cab mount plate (Item 23) at the top of shock absorber (Item 2).
Remove hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 12 and 11) at the mounting bracket of suspension crossmember bracket (Item 30) at the bottom of shock absorber (Item 2).
Remove shock absorber (Item 2) from between right cab mount plate (Item 23) and suspension crossmember bracket (Item 30).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Air Suspension Air Spring (Bag)

step1.para: Drain air from air system.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from air system, be sure air system is drained and be sure to set parking brake and/or block vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 122 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Loosen compression nut of push to connect elbow fitting (Item 6) and pull air line (to air spring) (Item 4) from push to connect elbow fitting at the bottom of driver side air spring (bag) (Item 1).

Loosen compression nut of push to connect elbow fitting (Item 6) and pull air line (to air spring) (Item 4) from push to connect elbow fitting at the bottom of passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 1).
Press and hold release button against fitting body and pull push to connect elbow fitting (Item 6) from both air springs (bags) (Item 1).
Remove jam nuts (Item 20) from the threaded stud at the bottom of both air springs (bags) (Item 1).
Carefully raise cab for enough clearance to remove air springs (bags) (Item 1) as follows.
Use a suitable jack placed on frame rail flange and back of cab floor frame (Figure 106) .
Once the jack is positioned properly, carefully raise cab for enough clearance to lift bottom threaded stud of both air springs (bags) (Item 1) from suspension crossmember bracket (Item 30).

caution.para: Over-raising of cab may cause component damage.

step1.para: Once the cab has been raised, screw air spring (bag) (Item 1) off threaded stud on left cab mount plate (Item 22), then slide air spring (bag) from between left cab mount plate and suspension crossmember bracket (Item 30).

Once the cab has been raised, screw air spring (bag) (Item 1) off threaded stud on right cab mount plate (Item 23), then slide air spring (bag) from between right cab mount plate and suspension crossmember bracket (Item 30).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Lateral Control Rod
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 122 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove lateral control rod (Item 24) as follows.

step2.para: Remove hex head bolt (Item 15) and hex lock nut (Item 16) from mounting bracket of suspension crossmember bracket (Item 30) and lateral control rod (Item 24).
Remove hex head bolt (Item 13) and hex lock nut (Item 14) from cab mount plate (Item 22) and lateral control rod (Item 24) and remove lateral control rod.
